org.easybatch.core.api.event.batch

Interface BatchProcessEventListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PoisonRecordBroadcaster

    public interface BatchProcessEventListener
    Enables the implementing class to get an event on different steps within the batch process.

    Use this interface when you want a listener that is not bound to a specific processor type, otherwise look at:

    • RecordReaderEventListener: for pre/post reading events
    • RecordFilterEventListener: for pre/post filtering events
    • RecordMapperEventListener: for pre/post mapping events
    • RecordValidatorEventListener: for pre/post validating events
    • RecordProcessorEventListener: for pre/post processing events
    Author:
    Mario Mueller (mario@xenji.com)

        void onException(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Called on any throwable event while processing.

        There is no context information available, so this will probably something you want to use for logging purposes or similar.

        Parameters:
        throwable - The exception thrown at the time of call.
